explanation: Load Stata's built-in auto dataset into memory, replacing any existing data.
Import a CSV file named myfile.csv  and replace any data currently in memory.
Load a Stata .dta file called myData.dta  into memory, replacing existing data.
Display variable names, types, formats, and labels for the dataset in memory.
Show mean, standard deviation, min, and max for variables price and mpg.
Provide detailed univariate statistics for price, including percentiles and kurtosis.
Show variable types, labels, unique values, and summary statistics for make and price.
Display a quick view of mpg distribution and number of missing or zero values.
Produce a one-way frequency table for rep78 including missing values.
Create a two-way table of foreign by rep78 and report chi-square and expected counts.
Count observations where price is greater than 5000.
List make and price for observations with price over 10,000 and nonmissing price.
Open the Data Editor to view and edit the dataset interactively.
Sort the dataset descending by price then descending by mpg.
Create a new variable mpgSq equal to mpg squared.
Create a byte (0/1) indicator lowPr equal to 1 when price is less than 4000.
Replace price values below 5000 with 5000.
Compute group mean of price for each value of foreign and store in meanPrice.
Create mpgQuartile containing quartile group (1–4) of mpg.
Store the distinct values of rep78 in a local macro called levels.
Define a local macro myLocal containing the variable names price, mpg, and length.
Define a global macro pathdata pointing to a directory for reuse across the session.
Create a temporary filename myAuto for saving data within a program or do-file.
Create a temporary variable name temp1 for use within a program or loop.
Save a temporary copy of the current dataset so you can restore it later.
Restore the dataset saved by the most recent preserve command.
Save the dataset in memory to myData.dta, overwriting any existing file.
Save dataset in Stata 12 format to ensure compatibility with older Stata versions.
Export the dataset to a comma-delimited CSV file, replacing if it exists.
Export data to Excel with variable names in the first row, replacing existing file.
Import Sheet1 from an Excel file using the first row as variable names and clear memory first.
Convert string variable foreignString to numeric and store result in foreignNumeric.
Encode a string categorical variable into numeric codes with value labels in foreignNumeric.
Create a string variable foreignString from numeric variable foreign using value labels.
Convert numeric variable foreign to a string variable foreignString.
Change the storage type of mpg to double precision.
Reduce memory usage by converting variables to the smallest appropriate storage types.
Replace missing values in all variables with the numeric code 9999 (useful for export).
Convert the numeric code 9999 back to missing for all variables.
Rename rep78 to repairRecord and foreign to carType in one command.
Define a value label named myLabel mapping 0 to "US" and 1 to "Not US".
Attach the value label myLabel to the numeric variable foreign.
Set the display format of price to show two decimal places in a width of 9.
Verify that price contains no missing values; Stata will throw an error if the assertion fails.
Report duplicate observations across all variables in the dataset.
Check whether id uniquely identifies observations; returns an error if not unique.
Count observations with nonmissing values of price.

code: tabstat price mpg, statistics(mean sd min max) by(foreign)
explanation: Report selected summary statistics for price and mpg by groups defined by foreign.
Estimate means and standard errors for price and mpg (e-class results not produced).
Compute 99% confidence intervals for the means of mpg and price.
Compute pairwise correlations among price, mpg, and weight and mark significant correlations at 5%.
Return the correlation matrix for mpg and price.
Create a scatterplot of mpg vs weight and label points with the make variable.
Draw a histogram of mpg with bin width 5, show frequencies, and overlay a kernel density.
Plot a kernel density estimate of mpg using bandwidth 3.
Create boxplots of price separately for each value of foreign.
Create a bar chart showing mean price for each category of foreign.
Overlay a scatterplot of mpg vs weight with a linear fit line.

code: twoway lowess mpg weight || scatter mpg weight
explanation: Plot a LOWESS smooth of mpg on weight and overlay the raw scatter.

code: twoway lfitci mpg weight || scatter mpg weight
explanation: Plot linear fit with confidence intervals for mpg on weight and overlay the scatter.
Create a binned scatterplot of weight vs mpg without a fitted line (requires binscatter package).
Install the user-written binscatter package from SSC, replacing any existing copy.
Export the most recent graph to a PNG file named myPlot.png, replacing if it exists.
Save the current graph in Stata's .gph format for later use.
Run OLS regression of price on mpg and weight with robust standard errors.

code: regress price mpg weight i.foreign, vce(cluster rep78)
explanation: OLS of price on mpg, weight and foreign indicators, clustering SEs by rep78.
Generate predicted values yhat for observations used in the last estimation (e-class sample).
Create a double-precision variable resid containing residuals from the last fitted model.
Perform the Breusch-Pagan/Cook-Weisberg test for heteroskedasticity after regression.
Report variance inflation factors to assess multicollinearity after regression.
Run Ramsey's RESET test for omitted-variable bias after a regression.
Compute DFBETA influence measures for the most recent regression model.
Plot residuals versus fitted values with a horizontal line at zero for diagnostic checking.
Produce added-variable (partial regression) plots for each regressor in the last model.
Estimate the linear combination headroom minus length and its standard error after regression.
Test the null hypothesis that the coefficient on headroom equals zero.
Compute the marginal effect (derivative) of length from the most recent model.
Estimate the elasticity of the outcome with respect to length from the last model.
Compute predicted outcomes at specified values of weight using the last estimation results.
Plot margins computed by margins, suppressing confidence intervals.
Bootstrap the regression of mpg on weight with 100 replications to obtain bootstrap SEs.
Compute jackknife standard error for the sample mean of mpg.
Run robust regression to reduce influence of outliers and generate weights in reg_wt.
Two-stage least squares: instrument mpg with gear when regressing price on mpg and weight.
Install the user-written ivreg2 package (commonly used for IV estimation) from SSC.
Run principal components analysis on price, mpg, and weight and keep three components.
Perform factor analysis extracting two factors from price, mpg, and weight.
Estimate a Poisson regression for countvar on x1 and x2 with robust standard errors.
Estimate a negative binomial regression for countvar on x1 and x2.
Estimate a Tobit model for y censored below at 0 with regressors x1 and x2.
Estimate logistic regression of foreign on headroom and mpg and report odds ratios.
Estimate a probit model for foreign with robust standard errors.
Perform a one-sample test of proportion that the mean of foreign equals 0.5.
Conduct a two-sample t-test comparing mpg means across values of foreign.
Perform a Wilcoxon rank-sum test for mpg between groups defined by foreign (nonparametric).
Run a Kolmogorov–Smirnov test comparing mpg distributions by foreign with exact p-value.
Perform one-way ANOVA of systolic by drug treatment groups.
Estimate pairwise mean comparisons of mpg across rep78 with Tukey multiple-comparison adjustment.
Declare survey design with primary sampling unit psuid, probability weights finalwgt, and strata stratid.
Estimate survey-weighted mean of age for each sex using the declared survey design.

code: svy: reg zinc c.age##c.age  female weight rural
explanation: Estimate a survey-weighted regression of zinc on age (with quadratic), female, weight, and rural.
Declare survival-time data with studytime as time variable and died as failure indicator.
Summarize survival-time data (e.g., number of failures, total time at risk).
Fit a Cox proportional hazards model of survival on drug and age.
Declare the dataset as time-series with time variable time and yearly frequency.
Plot a time-series line of the variable spot.
Create a new variable lag_spot equal to the one-period lag of spot (after tsset/xtset).
Fit an ARIMA model for spot with autoregressive lags 1 and 2.
Declare panel (longitudinal) data with panel id and time variable year.
Report panel data structure details (number of panels, time periods, gaps).
Summarize hours decomposing variance into between and within components for panel data.

code: xtreg ln_w c.age##c.age  ttl_exp, fe vce(robust)
explanation: Fit a fixed-effects panel regression of ln_w on age (with quadratic) and ttl_exp with robust SEs.
Plot panel line plots of ln_wage for panels with id up to 22 and label every third tick.
Estimate a random-effects panel regression of price on mpg and weight.

code: xtabond y L.y x1 x2, lags(1)
explanation: Estimate a dynamic panel model using Arellano-Bond style GMM (xtabond) with lag instruments.
Estimate average treatment effects using propensity-score matching for outcome y and covariates x1 x2.
Estimate difference-in-differences effect of treatment on y with group and time identifiers.

code: synth outcome treatedvar predictors(...), trunit(1) trperiod(2000)
explanation: Run synthetic control analysis for treated unit 1 with treatment starting in 2000 (requires synth package).
Perform Blinder–Oaxaca decomposition of wage differences by group (requires oaxaca package).
Merge the dataset ind_age.dta one-to-one on id into the current dataset and create _merge indicator.
Append observations from coffeeMaize2.dta  and create filenum to track source file.

code: reshape long coffee maize, i(country) j(year)
explanation: Convert wide-format variables coffee* and maize* into long format with id country and time year.

code: reshape wide coffee maize, i(country) j(year)
explanation: Convert long-format coffee and maize variables into wide format with year appended to names.
Perform a many-to-one merge of hh2.dta  into the current dataset keyed by hid.

code: reclink id name using "other.dta", idmaster(id) idusing(id2) gen(score)
explanation: Perform probabilistic (fuzzy) matching between datasets using reclink and generate similarity score (requires reclink package).
Create a new Stata frame named newdata to hold a separate dataset in memory (Stata frames feature).
Switch the active frame to newdata so subsequent commands operate on it.
Prepare to write results to an Excel file named results.xlsx, replacing any existing file (used with putexcel commands).
Export a collected table (from collect) to an HTML file named table1.html.

code: etable, estimates(est1 est2) column(index) showstars export(autoreg.txt)
explanation: Export a comparison table of stored estimates est1 and est2 to a text file with significance stars.
Store the most recent estimation results in memory under the name est1 for later comparison.
Restore previously stored estimation results named est1 as the active e-class results.
List the variance-covariance matrix of estimators (e(V)) from the most recent estimation.
Create a 3x1 matrix b with elements 4, 5, and 6.
Create a scalar named a1 with numeric value 3.
Display the coefficient estimate for variable length from the most recent regression.
Display the standard error of the coefficient on length from the last model.
Close any open log file, suppressing errors if no log is open (capture prevents error messages).
Start logging the session output to myDoFile.txt, replacing any existing file.
Set the random-number seed to 12345 for reproducible sampling and bootstrap results.
Randomly sample 25 percent of observations from the dataset (use set seed for reproducibility).

code: foreach x of varlist mpg weight length { summarize x' }
explanation: Loop over variables mpg, weight, and length and run summarize for each.
Loop with numeric iterator i from 1 to 10 and display each value.

code: while i' <= 10 { displayi' ; local i = i' + 1 }
explanation: Run a while loop that displays i and increments it until i exceeds 10.
Print the number of observations in the dataset using display and the system macro _N.
Store the distinct values of car_make in a local macro named cmake for later iteration.

code: foreach x of local cmake { display "x'" }
explanation: Iterate over the local macro cmake and display each element.
Silently drop a program named myprog if it exists, avoiding an error if it does not.
Turn on tracing to debug program execution; use set trace off to disable.
Open Stata's help file for the regress command to view syntax and options.
Search SSC and Stata resources for the package or command named mdesc.
Install the adolist package from SSC to list user-written ado-files.
Update installed user-written ado-files to their latest versions from SSC.
